diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Recurrent pancreatitis due to CFTR and SPINK1 mutations, triggered by alcohol.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of recurrent pancreatitis was made based on the patient's history of recurrent episodes of abdominal pain and laboratory findings indicating acute pancreatitis. Genetic testing revealed mutations in the CFTR and SPINK1 genes, which are associated with an increased risk of pancreatitis. The episodes were triggered by alcohol consumption.
